newsitem.title: USA: AK Steel looks at Ohio, Indiana plant - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: AK Steel looks at Ohio, Indiana plant - WSJ.

text.p: AK Steel Holding Corp is thinking about building a $1.1 billion steel-processing plant in Ohio or Indiana, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday.
The newspaper said the company's board of directors was to meet November 20 to discuss the project.
It quoted people close to the matter as saying the company was strongly considering a 1,500-acre site in Rockport, Indiana.
The company had also been looking at a 1,300-acre site in Licking County, Ohio, it added.
The newspaper said AK Steel would spend an estimated $165 million to build the plant and another $935 million on the equipment.
